# TryHackMe - c4ptur3-th3-fl4g

# Task 1 - Translation & Shifting

```bash
1. c4n y0u c4p7u23 7h3 f149?

Ans: Can you capture the flag?
```

```bash
2. 01101100 01100101 01110100 01110011 00100000 01110100 01110010 01111001 00100000 01110011 01101111 01101101 01100101 00100000 01100010 01101001 01101110 01100001 01110010 01111001 00100000 01101111 01110101 01110100 00100001

This is binary!

Ans: lets try some binary out!
```

```bash
3.MJQXGZJTGIQGS4ZAON2XAZLSEBRW63LNN5XCA2LOEBBVIRRHOM======

This is base32!

Ans: base32 is super common in CTF's
```

```bash
4. RWFjaCBCYXNlNjQgZGlnaXQgcmVwcmVzZW50cyBleGFjdGx5IDYgYml0cyBvZiBkYXRhLg==

This is base64!

Ans: Each Base64 digit represents exactly 6 bits of data.
```

```bash
5. Ebgngr zr 13 cynprf!

This is ROT13!

Ans: Rotate me 13 places!
```

```bash
6. *@F DA:? >6 C:89E C@F?5 323J C:89E C@F?5 Wcf E:>6DX

This is ROT47!

Ans: You spin me right round baby right round (47 times)
```

```bash

7. - . .-.. . -.-. --- -- -- ..- -. .. -.-. .- - .. --- -.

. -. -.-. --- -.. .. -. --.

This is morse code!

Ans:  TELECOMMUNICATION  ENCODING
```

```bash
8. 85 110 112 97 99 107 32 116 104 105 115 32 66 67 68

This is decimal!

Ans: Unpack this BCD
```

```bash
9. 

Base64, Morse Code, Binary, Rot47, Decimal.

Ans: Let's make this a bit trickier...
```

## Spectograms

```bash
The downloaded file was analyzed with Audacity. I changed the view to Spectogram which revealed the flag.

The flag is Super Secret Message

```

![Spectogram](./spectogram.png)

## Steganography

```bash
Decode the image to reveal the answer.

We can use steghide to extract the hidden message.


```

## Security through obscurity

```bash
Download and get 'inside' the file. What is the first filename & extension?

In the terminal, type strings meme.jpg.

Ans: hackerchat.png
```

```bash
Get inside the archive and inspect the file carefully. Find the hidden text.

In the terminal, type strings meme.jpg.

Ans: AHH_YOU_FOUND_ME!
```
